name: importation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the act of introducing new goods, customs, or ideas into a country from another country; something that is introduced in this way: He opposed efforts to allow the importation of prescription drugs from other countries. The treaty restricts the importation of cultural artifacts. He is believed to have organized massive importations of drugs before his arrest.
[ U ]
  computing
  specialized the act of copying information from one computer or computer program to another: Convert the scanned document into text for importation into other software programs. We developed a compatible data table for importation into statistical and spreadsheet programs. See
import
More examplesFewer examplesThe virus may have spread to North America through the importation of an infected mosquito.Scots and modern English evolved in parallel from Old English, with importations from many other languages. The less dust you leave in your LPs' grooves, the less noise you'll have to clean up after importation to your computer.

COMMERCE the process or business of bringing goods into a country from another country: the importation of sth into/from sth VAT is due on the importation of goods into the UK from other EC countries.
